column2: NEW MEXICO DMV PERMIT TEST
column6: NM

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. A red traffic signal light means that you must:
column6: when there is no stop line, stop before entering any crosswalk.
column8: where there is no stop line or crosswalk, stop before entering the intersection.

column2: 2. When turning or changing lanes, drivers must:
column4: signal only if there is traffic.
column6: signal only when driving in traffic at night.
column8: signal only when driving at night.
column10: always signal their intentions even when there are no vehicles.

column2: 3. This road sign means:
column6: No right turn
column8: Two way right turn

column2: 4. The only effective way to reduce your blood alcohol content (BAC) is:
column6: not to drink over a period of time.
column8: taking a cold shower.

column2: 5. Drivers should be aware that a motorcyclist may:
column4: quickly change speed or lane position.
column6: decrease speed and rise off the seat when approaching a railroad crossing.
column8: move to the center of the lane on steel deck bridges.

column2: 6. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: the road surface ahead changes to a low-type surface or earth road.
column6: the dirt on the side of the road is soft.
column8: vehicles must leave the pavement immediately.

column2: 7. Most signs used in street work areas are:
column6: rectangle shaped.
column8: regulatory signs.

column2: 8. A four-way stop sign means:
column4: traffic from all four directions must stop.
column6: if two vehicles reach the intersection at the same time, the driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.
column8: there are four stop signs at this intersection.

column2: 9. When an emergency vehicle approaches using a siren, air horn or a red or blue flashing light, drivers must move to the right side of the road and stop until the vehicle has passed.
column6: True

column2: 10. To check your blind spot before changing lanes:
column4: look into the right side mirror.
column6: look into the rearview mirror.
column8: look into the left side mirror.
column10: look over your shoulder in the direction you plan to move.

column2: 11. If one of your tires blows out while driving, you should:
column6: hold the steering wheel firmly, slow down, and steer smoothly.
column8: apply the brakes firmly and steer toward the right edge of the road.
column10: hold the steering wheel tightly and shift into neutral to bring the front of the vehicle back in line.

column2: 12. When you get in a car to drive, the first thing you should do is:
column6: adjust the steering wheel.
column8: adjust your seat belt.

column2: 13. A defensive driver:
column4: never drives below the speed limit.
column6: considers what other drivers might do and is always prepared to act.
column8: knows when it is safe to pass other vehicles.

column2: 14. When passing a pedestrian who is walking on the road and an oncoming vehicle is approaching, you should:
column4: slow down and let the vehicle pass first.
column6: keep driving, you have the right-of-way.
column8: honk your horn to warn the pedestrian.

column2: 15. If you approach a flashing red traffic light, you should treat the intersection the same as:
column6: a yield sign.
column8: a stop sign.

column2: 16. BAC is expressed in:
column6: percentage of blood to alcohol.
column8: ounces of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 17. When driving in fog:
column6: drive the speed limit.
column8: do not drive over 10 MPH.

column2: 18. A steady green light at intersections means:
column4: You may drive through the intersection if the road is clear
column6: You must stop and check for oncoming traffic before proceeding
column8: You must increase your speed

column2: 19. Your blind spot is the area of the road:
column6: you see in your side mirror.
column8: you see in your rearview mirror.
column10: you cannot see without moving your head.

column2: 20. Diamond-shaped signs:
column6: are used to warn of hazards on roadways.
column8: typically provide guidance to drivers.

column2: 21. This road sign means:
column6: Turn right
column8: Flagger ahead

column2: 22. This road sign means:
column6: Winding road
column8: Double curve ahead

column2: 23. An inattentive driver:
column6: gazes at objects off the roadway while driving.
column8: carries on an eye-contact conversation with a passenger while driving.

column2: 24. When driving in a construction zone you should:
column6: come to a complete stop and check road conditions.
column8: slightly increase your speed.

column2: 25. It's 10 AM. This sign tells you that:
column4: you must display a special permit in order to park here.
column6: you are not allowed to park here.
column8: you must park your car between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column10: you are allowed to park until 5:30 PM.
